column3: Kingfung 3-6 Pack Women's Invisible Seamless Bikini Underwear Half Back Coverage Panties
column11: It's true, they really updated the sizing- it is much better now
column15: I ordered these without knowing what to expect after the September 15th size correction update listed in the description. With the hopes that this will help someone else: according to the size chart posted, I *should* have ordered an extra large. To me, that felt silly becuase I would normally go straight for a medium. I took a chance and purchased the large, which is only supposed to fit up to a 27 inch waist (very skewed, but ok). My hip circumference is 39 inches around the biggest part of my butt, and the size large are super comfortable- they fit perfectly without stretching at all. I probably could have ordered the medium and been fine since these do stretch, but I have experienced no rolling or falling down or anything so I am happy. I was also worried that the lace back would show up under some of my work pants, but that is not the case at all. Even with body hugging outfits you can't see these, plus they're cute and I really liked the color variety. This is a steal compared to the 20-30 dollar a pair underwear you see in department stores (btw, when the heck did undies get so dang expensive?). Overall I am very happy, but I do think the size chart should be updated to make the sizing less confusing.

column3: Kingfung 3-6 Pack Women's Invisible Seamless Bikini Underwear Half Back Coverage Panties
column11: I dislike full bottom panties but these are really pretty and ...
column15: These panties are worthy of 5/5 stars IF I were only judging fit and looks. If you follow the manufacturer’s sizing chart, (not Amazon’s) then you will be pleasantly surprised. I ordered manufacturer’s size M which is equivalent to a US size S. Your waistline for this size should be between 22.0 - 27.5 in. For reference, I’m a size 2 with narrow hips and a very small booty. As far as looks, I dislike full bottom panties but these are really pretty and I don’t feel like I have a bunch of fabric getting ready to target and hike up in to my crack.I took off one star because while the back of these lacy beauty’s are completely seamless under clothes (if you get the right size), the front is a different situation. The fabric is thick and double-lined with reverse stitching. So, the seams are sewn on the inside which creates an unflattering, bulky outline through fitted clothes. That makes the whole point of these ‘seamless’ panties counter productive.Overall, I don’t regret this purchase and these panties will work just fine under flowy dresses/skirts and loose fitting pants. Hope this review helps.

column15: So I will start off by saying I am very picky about my underwear - it must be (mostly) cotton, super comfortable and not give me any sort of muffin top whatsoever.  These guys hit all of my underwear requirements right on the head!  I have been searching for the perfect thongs for a while now and I feel like my search is over with these.  I was wearing the cotton thongs with lace waist prior and although they are great at not marking under clothes, the lace falls apart way too fast in the wash and I don't find them to be nearly as comfortable as these.  I will also mention that I have only washed these once so far so I cannot comment on the longevity just yet but I think they'll hold up way better than the lace ones.A few things:1. Two were repeats.  I don't care about this and neither does the hubs.2. They do have tags on the back and I wish they didn't.  The tags have to be cut off as opposed to being able to remove them completely by un-sewing them.  This is the only negative for me.3. Some are softer than others but they're all still very comfortable.4. The cotton crotch lining piece is bigger than in any of my other thongs which I really like.  It comes up higher in the front.5. They are snug and stay perfectly in place without creating any tightness in the waist.  I practically don't even feel them.6. They come in patterns which makes them cuter than the all plain colored ones usually available in cotton.I hope this review helps someone else since I know how difficult it can be to find perfect underwear.  I love these so much I am about to order my second pack because I'm worried they'll either stop selling them or they'll alter how they're made somehow.Update 8/9/18 - attaching a picture of packs two and three I just received.  They came in the exact same patterns as the first pack and the two repeats are also the same (plain beige and purple pattern).  I will note the price went up a bit - I paid $19.86 for the first pack and $21.17 for the other two packs.  I love these so much I don't want to wear any of my other underwear anymore.  Also, I have now washed and dried the first pack a few times and they still look brand new.

column11: Attractive and won't ride up!  Size 6/8 in pants, medium fits perfect.
column15: Thank you, Amazon.  It only took about 8 years, but I'm now back to feeling bliss again in my cotton undies.  I guess I can officially throw away the 10-year old V. Secret undies I've been hoarding since they changed their style to one that only 6-year old girls can wear.  My husband thanks you for that.  These undies are incredibly comfy and WILL NOT RIDE UP.  I am 44 and wear a size 6/8 with a real booty, and the medium fits great.  The elastic doesn't feel like it's even there, but believe me it works. Yes, they show a panty line.  If anyone tells you they don't, then they are either lying or are wearing very baggy pants.  I don't wear them under tight pants - thats what thongs are for.  I do, however, put them on immediately after coming home from work and when I'm wearing looser clothing.  They're also a dream to sleep in.  They get softer as you wash them.  I've bought every package of these that Amazon offers and was tickled pink to see they finally added a pack of only black.  My only negative is the look (which luckily just doesn't matter so much to me since I'm not an underwear model.)  To me, they are a cross between bikinis and lower briefs.  The band on the side is much wider than typical bikinis, but I'm guessing that might be why the fit across the butt is perfect.  My pictures are of one pair of washed undies so you see what they look like in real life.  So, Amazon....please don't go changing things.  Don't put spandex in and cut the back so they look like bad thongs that real women can't wear.  Please keep them just the way they are and make a million more colors.  I will continue to buy them and hoard them like the 80s.  Bye Bye, Vic's Secret.  I'm too old for you.

column11: I Love These Underwear and They are a Great Alternative to Expensive Ones!
column15: Several months ago, I purchased some new cotton bikini underwear and prefer them over other, more revealing styles. I'm a mom and I've discovered I prefer comfort over style so cotton bikinis suit me really well! I saw these underwear and I'll admit, I was a bit skeptical because I wondered if they would be good quality or not. I have some items from the Amazon Basics line and like them so I figured I'd give these a try.The Amazon Essentials Cotton Bikini underwear come in a six-pack and you can currently choose from two styles: basic assorted and fashion assorted. The basic assorted package comes with the following colors: two white, one light pink, one light purple, one black, and one black and white stripe. The fashion assorted package contains: one salmon color, one navy, one navy and white stripe, one light purple, one white with black polka dots, and one white with black flowers. These underwear are made of 95% cotton and 5% elastane. You can machine wash in warm water and tumble dry low. These are made in Sri Lanka.I initially ordered the basic assorted package and liked them enough that I immediately ordered the fashion assorted package as well. The underwear are very soft and comfortable! I really like the variety of colors and I would buy more if they decided to provide more colors. I've washed these underwear several times now according to the instructions and I didn't notice any shrinking. The stitching looks like good quality and I love that they don't ride up, which means these will work nicely when I exercise! I usually wear yoga pants and notice slight panty lines but they are hardly noticeable if you aren't looking for them. The bikini style sits comfortably at my hip and the band at the waist measures 2 3/8 inches. For size reference, I am 5'6", 165 pounds with a bit of a belly after having my twins and I purchased the large size which fit perfectly. I generally wear a 10 or 12 in pants and am glad I purchased the large.I am happy I found these because they are incredibly comfortable. When I wear them, I actually hardly notice I'm wearing them because they are so light and comfortable! If Amazon decided to make more of these in different colors, I will definitely buy those as well. If you are looking for a good-quality, inexpensive and comfortable option to very expensive underwear, these are it! If these don't last as long as I'd like, I will update this review. Until then, I recommend these underwear because they are some of the most comfortable underwear I've owned and they don't cost an arm and a leg!

column11: A bit smaller than expected. Not all styles/colors are the same material.
column15: My husband and I share this account, so ignore the name. For the sake of the review I felt it was important to clarify that I am a woman.I purchased two packs of these in different colors. First, it's important to note that these are not all the same material. One pack I received was polyester and the other was cotton. I thought I was receiving polyester per the description. I just went back to check the listing to make sure I didn't miss anything and apparently I did. If you select a different style/color, the description of the underwear does NOT change until you ALSO select a size. This was an oversight on my part but was also a bit misleading. I like to be pretty active and I'm not a fan of how cotton underwear tends to stretch and get baggy throughout the day so I returned the cotton ones. The polyester ones are a cheaper itchier material than what I am used to. Especially for the brand. Not bad. Just OK. The size was also smaller than I expected. I usually wear an XL and have even lost 10lbs recently but these are a bit tight. Still wearable but if I were to order again, I would definitely go up a size without fear of them being too big. Overall, if you are looking for OK, basic underwear, go for it.  If you were looking for something a bit nicer, I'd look elsewhere.

column11: Most Uncomfortable Bra I think I have ever worn
column15: I wear a size 40C and ordered that size. This bra looks absolutely beautiful and washed well in the washer on gentle cycle in a lingerie bag. I turned the bra inside out also so that the lace was on the inside instead. {There were other clothes also in the washer at the same time}. The bra is really pretty and seems well made.The cup size is a bit large even though it is padded. I wore it and spent the entire day adjusting the straps and trying to get the bra band to stay down. So, the band could have been too large {I lost 5 pounds between buying it and wearing it}, but the sides cut into me and I would not order a smaller size because of that. This is truly the most uncomfortable bra that I have ever worn.It was very annoying in so many ways. The lace is very scratchy even though it was washed before wearing. The side wires really dig in, but the cups were larger than expected.The bra rode up constantly and just didn't fit or feel right. It is like it stretched from the time I put it on until I took it off. Weird.It is an adorable bra and if it didn't have those issues would be a 4 or 5 star bra for how well it is made. As it is though... three stars as I really hate it, but added a star for it being well made and  I also love all the different colors that this bra comes in. column15: I bought this to wear under my bridesmaid's dress for my best friend's wedding and it felt and looked great! I know that pant sizes and all that jazz are funky wherever you go (perks of buying women's clothes... NOT), so I'm going to tell you that I'm a size 10/12 (I fluctuate depending on time-of-the-month) in American Eagle "Denim X" super-stretch, high-waisted jeans. I've bought shapewear before that was too big, which doesn't help anybody, so I figured I'd buy a size or two smaller than what the size chart said. Apparently, I should be a 3XL, but I ended up buying an XL and it fit well! A little right, sure, but I wanted it that way to help keep everything "locked and loaded." What I love about this shaper is that it's super cute! I mean, it's not like anyone was going to see it anyway, but I felt pretty wearing it. Most shapers are ugly with no flare or anything to it. This shaper has a more lingerie-type look, which honestly helped to boost my confidence. I still wear this shaper whenever I wear dresses. Definitely give it a try, but be sure to consider how "tightly packed" you want to feel in it. Again, remember that I wanted mine tight, so I bought 2 sizes smaller than what size the chart says I should have. If that's not your thing, I'd go for 1 size smaller than recommended for a more relaxed fit that'll still hold you together. I feel like buying "true" size wouldn't help, but that's just me. Hope this helped!

column11: Amazon Essentials Women's Cotton Hi-Cut Brief
column15: Basic and without embellishments, these high-cut briefs are made from 95 percent cotton and 5 percent elastane for breathability and stretch. Very comfortable to wear, the construction eliminates bunching or riding up and they are tag-less.  The fabric is finely woven and very soft. Appealing in its simplicity the undergarment is finished with delicate 1/4 inch hems at the leg holes and waistline.Fabric care is reasonably non-fussy. Machine wash warm with like colors on delicate cycle and tumble dry low heat. No iron or bleach. I am usually between a medium and large but because of the cotton content I went up a size in the event of significant shrinkage but that was not necessary.After laundering, they looked as good as when I put them in the wash and shrinkage was minimal with 3/8 inch in length and 1/4 inch in height. Sizing is correct and since shrinkage is not an issue, next time I would select my usual size.The basic assortment is made up of neutral colors and includes black and white horizontal stripe, black, grey, beige and two pairs of white. Very compact, so besides usual daily use they would be excellent to pack when traveling. If necessary, they could be hand washed easily drying overnight. Modestly priced, functional and subtly feminine.

column11: Thank you Amazon for ending my years long search.
column15: Cotton stretch undies with tape elastic are weirdly hard to find anymore (at least in my size), but these fit the bill nicely. Usually I wear a 9 o 10 in underwear so I bought these in an XXL (I am "plus size" usually wearing a size 20 in pants and dresses) Great generous cut, with the perfect rise, full coverage back and a just right cut leg. Took off one star because while the fabric is soft and comfortable it is a bit on the thin size, which honestly isn't unexpected. Might order these in the basic colors too if the multi print pack holds up over the next few months. I will say, the blue stripey ones are a little on the cheap looking side, but the rest are cute. Beware, the coral ones are very bright (edging towards neon) peachy orange coral, not the muted sort of dusky coral in the photos. The rest are accurate colors.

column11: Comfortable and no ride-up, but don't wear them with pantiliners/pads
column15: I normally get all-cotton panties in this style, so when I saw these 95% cotton ones much cheaper than the name brand ones I usually get, I thought they'd be worth a try.  My first impression was that, although they are soft, they don't feel like cotton at all.  They're much stretchier.  That's not necessarily a down side, and they're quite comfortable to wear without riding up.  However, if you wear them with pantiliners, pads, etc., the adhesive will NOT stick to this fabric.  The crotch area is the same slick, stretchy fabric as the rest of the panty.  For that reason, I wouldn't purchase them again, but I'll continue to wear this set.  One other small issue is that the "tagless" label in the back is bulky enough that you can feel it on the outside.  I'm concerned that it may start peeling off in the wash and become uncomfortable.

column15: I was pleasantly surprised by these undies. Often when I buy high leg briefs, they either fit too high or too low on the waist, or too large in the rear. I no longer even try to buy Hanes, Fruit of the Loom, or any other multi-pack undies typically found in stores, because the fit is always terrible. I thought I was doomed to buy overpriced Victoria's Secret briefs forever, since they are some of the only ones I've ever found that fit me properly. I feel like I am neither short or long waisted, so I don't understand why there are so many fit issues with what should be basic undies. These fit perfectly, though! They reach just underneath my belly button, so I wouldn't call them granny panties, but they aren't bikinis, either. These are how high leg briefs should always fit, in much opinion. I didn't notice any shrinkage at all when washed in cold water and dried on low heat. They are holding up very well so far and appear to be very good quality. No issues with wedgies or sliding around, either. Very comfortable!I wear a size 14 in pants, and ordered size XL. I'm sure they could also fit a size 16, as I'm currently 4 months pregnant and they still fit great.

column15: I bought the mediums and they run true to size. For reference, I'm pear-shaped with a big butt at 34" around my hip bones and 42" around the widest part of my butt. That makes me both a medium and a large in US sizes at the same time, so I never know which to buy. Since a thong usually goes ::ahem:: inbetwixt the cheeks, I usually go with the smaller size which worked out well in this case. My weight and size also tend to yoyo a lot, but these are so stretchy and breathable that I think they will work well for a variety of weights, sizes, and body types which is a huge plus.If you're on the fence about what size to get, I would suggest ordering the size you normally wear. If you're in between sizes and most of your girth is in your butt, I would go with the smaller size. If you're in between and most of your girth is in your hips and belly, I would go with the larger size.The fabric is listed as 95% cotton and 5% spandex. They are very thin which makes them super breathable and comfortable even on hot days, but because of that the lighter colors are pretty much sheer and I could see these wearing out or developing holes in a pretty short period of time. I don't anticipate them lasting more than a year. But for this price, there are going to be some consessions. They also have a gusset, which I prefer and find more comfortable.The only thing I was really dissapointed about were the colors. I wasn't deterred by the "random assortment" because I liked all of the colors pictured. Unfortunately, the colors I received aren't any of the ones pictured. I got 2 packs with 5 pairs in each, both with the same assortment (lame). But the colors are all light pink and coral pastel patterns that I would never have picked and the white trim makes them look like little girls' underoos. They remind me of the packs of Disney panties I would get as a kid. Fine for a tween or teen, but at my age it feels a bit creepy. I'm not going to return them because I need new thongs and the price is right... but I definitely won't be wearing these on date night. That alone is why I won't be repurchasing these.

column15: So I will start off by saying I am very picky about my underwear - it must be (mostly) cotton, super comfortable and not give me any sort of muffin top whatsoever.  These guys hit all of my underwear requirements right on the head!  I have been searching for the perfect thongs for a while now and I feel like my search is over with these.  I was wearing the cotton thongs with lace waist prior and although they are great at not marking under clothes, the lace falls apart way too fast in the wash and I don't find them to be nearly as comfortable as these.  I will also mention that I have only washed these once so far so I cannot comment on the longevity just yet but I think they'll hold up way better than the lace ones.A few things:1. Two were repeats.  I don't care about this and neither does the hubs.2. They do have tags on the back and I wish they didn't.  The tags have to be cut off as opposed to being able to remove them completely by un-sewing them.  This is the only negative for me.3. Some are softer than others but they're all still very comfortable.4. The cotton crotch lining piece is bigger than in any of my other thongs which I really like.  It comes up higher in the front.5. They are snug and stay perfectly in place without creating any tightness in the waist.  I practically don't even feel them.6. They come in patterns which makes them cuter than the all plain colored ones usually available in cotton.I hope this review helps someone else since I know how difficult it can be to find perfect underwear.  I love these so much I am about to order my second pack because I'm worried they'll either stop selling them or they'll alter how they're made somehow.Update 8/9/18 - attaching a picture of packs two and three I just received.  They came in the exact same patterns as the first pack and the two repeats are also the same (plain beige and purple pattern).  I will note the price went up a bit - I paid $19.86 for the first pack and $21.17 for the other two packs.  I love these so much I don't want to wear any of my other underwear anymore.  Also, I have now washed and dried the first pack a few times and they still look brand new.

column15: I adore this halter style babydoll nightie.  I got the babydoll lingerie in the purple color and it is a gorgeous rich color. I am just under 5’4” and currently wear a size medium or 6-8 but I am busty, 34DD, so I sometimes have to get a large or xl in tops depending on the style and fabric. Since these are Asian sizes and looking at their sizing chart I decided to go with size extra-large.  It fit a little big so I could have gone with a size large and it would have been fine.  But where the wide ribbon ties connect to the bodice and because it ties behind the neck halter style I don’t have to worry too much about it falling down.  The lace material across the bust is very stretchy and so soft with a scalloped edge. The rest of the nightie is a soft, stretchy, flowy, sheer material.  The material is a blend of 65% polyester and 35% cotton.  The ribbons are soft, satiny, and wide and look very lush.  The panties are made from the same soft lace as the bodice.  This set is very comfortable to wear and sexy and flirty and the length hit me like a mini dress.  It is very flattering.  The care is simple, I placed it in a lingerie bag and washed it on gentle cycle cold with detergent for delicates then laid it flat to dry.  It dries quickly.  It is sewn well and I have had no loose strings or fraying.  I purchased my babydoll nightie at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

column7: ['fruit of the loom', 'highly recommend', 'colors shown', 'poor quality', 'true to size', 'fell apart', 'good quality', 'soft and comfortable', 'really like', 'even though', 'perfect fit', 'wash well', 'panty line', 'waistband', 'great price', 'panties ever', 'belly button', 'dry quickly', 'waste your money', 'cheaply made']
column15: I took a gamble on ordering these and I am so glad I did. For years I wore a traditional fit hi waist style from Jockey.  I was very disappointed to find that Jockey was no longer making that style so I have spent the past few months searching online for something comparable.  I came across these Fruit of the Loom briefs. They are made of a very similar fabric and the fit is very comfortable.  There are a few differences between the two.  These do not have a seam down the back (which doesn't really matter to me).  These do seem slightly more stretchy but I consider that a pro not a con.  Be aware that a few of the colors shown online are not the same as the ones in the packages I received.  The colors are more in the pastel family than in the jewel tones as shown. This might be of importance to some if they are planning on color coordinating.  I personally will take comfort over color any day, particularly since it is for an article of clothing that I am going to wear under other clothing. I did get a black pair and a white pair as displayed. I got a bright (bubble gum) pink instead of the deep purple. I got a soft dove grey instead of the slate grey.  The blue is more like a powder blue.  The last pair is a pleasant light lavender.

column11: Very comfortable and has a surprising amount of stretch and breathability
column15: I love the material. It's incredibly breathable and stretchable in spite of the fact that it's supportive wear. It's also strong and durable when being washed and dried, unlike other types of lace that I have bought. It's forgiving yet still supportive; I don't think I've ever worn any other type of control-top underwear before that was actually effective without being constricting or ridiculously uncomfortable (I'd even go so far as to recommend buying these over more expensive brands like Spanx or Maiden Form).As for the complaints about having to order a size up:I ordered the XXL (my size in other brands) and XXXL (the size that was recommended) just to compare the fit. Although the fit in the XXL was tighter, I found it stretched out fine as I wore them; the XXXL fit more comfortably, but the biggest difference seemed to be in where the waistline hit me and that it didn't squeeze me in as much. I preferred the size up since I have a long torso and wanted more coverage. If a customer wants more support or a tighter fit, they should probably go with the smaller size.

column11: As pictured. Runs large. Buy a cup size down & perhaps a band size down.
column15: This review is for Vogue's Secret Women's Unlined Plus Size See-through Bra Sexy Lace Mesh Transparent Breathable.It should be noted that the bra and panty must be ordered separately. This is clearly said in the pictures and description but still worth saying again given they are shown in the same picture together.The item arrived with the rest of my order. The bra itself is packed in a resealable clear bag so it is visible to anyone around when you open the box.In my opinion this item is more of a special occasion bra then an everyday bra. I don't think it would last long with everyday wear and washing.On to size: The recipient measures 35-1/4” band and 37-1/2” bust, so by most sizing charts she measures to a 36B.She wears a 36B in most brands including: Playtex, Maidenform, Vassarette, XOXO and so on. But sometimes a 34B will fit better, especially when a snug fit is desirable such as a non-padded bra. For example, she has a bra similar to this item made by Calvin Klein in a 34B and it fits her perfectly.The body is fairly stretchy and doesn't offer much in the way of support. With a 34B she usually wears it on the largest hook, but on this bra the body is so stretchy it easily fit her on the on the smallest hook.The underwires sit where they should. It has a standard two hook rear closure and adjustable shoulder straps.Unfortunately the cups are simply too large. The 34B cups fit like a 34C with an undesirable extra fabric pooch on the top half of the cup. It should be noted the cups are stretchy and if you can fill them it looks just like in the item pictures.As far as fit goes you have to size this item for the cups. You can always add a black two hook band extender to add band size but cup fit can't be adjusted. I'd recommend buying a cup size down, this way the cups stretch a little to fit and look good. And given the stretchy nature of the band you may want to buy a band size down also.Why four stars?The bra is as pictured and of good quality for an occasional use item. The only real issue is fit, and fit is often a problem with bras because of their complex shape. But I can only forgive fit so far. The recipient wears a 36B or 34B in almost all other bras. I bought the smaller of the two and it was still too large, so in my opinion this item does not run true to size. - Minus one star.Overall I like the item. I would buy it again if I could get a smaller size but they don't offer one as of the time of this review. I would recommend it to a friend if they can get a size that fits them.***PS: I noticed under my name it says "Size: 34C" and this is incorrect. I ordered, received, and reviewed a 34B bra. The sizing sticker is visible in my picture.

column11: Nice but you don't get what is pictured AT ALL!!
column15: These were really pretty and not a bad price considering you get 8 of them. I'm sure I would have loved these..IF THE ONES I ORDERED WERE ACTUALLY THE ONES I GOT!!! The print WAYYYY down at the bottom states "you may not get exact colors" etc.Well there are 8 pair and I got 3 doubles out of 8 total!! They show all these various pretty colored ones and what you get is 2 pair of one style..2 pair of another style..and 2 pair of another style..then one other..then one other. So what happens, which was EXACTLY what I hoped would NOT happen..I got doubles of the ones I don't like so much and I NEVER GOT THE TWO THAT I INITIALLY ORDERED THESE FOR!!! There is nothing WORSE then to SEE what you want, PAY for it, then get NONE of the style you wanted!! So yes..read all the way at the bottom of their description and KNOW..you will NOT get what is pictured!! When THIS company can correct that..people should NOT order these at ALL!! column7: ['fruit of the loom', 'highly recommend', 'colors shown', 'poor quality', 'true to size', 'fell apart', 'good quality', 'soft and comfortable', 'really like', 'even though', 'perfect fit', 'wash well', 'panty line', 'waistband', 'great price', 'panties ever', 'belly button', 'dry quickly', 'waste your money', 'cheaply made']
column15: I took a gamble on ordering these and I am so glad I did. For years I wore a traditional fit hi waist style from Jockey.  I was very disappointed to find that Jockey was no longer making that style so I have spent the past few months searching online for something comparable.  I came across these Fruit of the Loom briefs. They are made of a very similar fabric and the fit is very comfortable.  There are a few differences between the two.  These do not have a seam down the back (which doesn't really matter to me).  These do seem slightly more stretchy but I consider that a pro not a con.  Be aware that a few of the colors shown online are not the same as the ones in the packages I received.  The colors are more in the pastel family than in the jewel tones as shown. This might be of importance to some if they are planning on color coordinating.  I personally will take comfort over color any day, particularly since it is for an article of clothing that I am going to wear under other clothing. I did get a black pair and a white pair as displayed. I got a bright (bubble gum) pink instead of the deep purple. I got a soft dove grey instead of the slate grey.  The blue is more like a powder blue.  The last pair is a pleasant light lavender.

column15: I love the material. It's incredibly breathable and stretchable in spite of the fact that it's supportive wear. It's also strong and durable when being washed and dried, unlike other types of lace that I have bought. It's forgiving yet still supportive; I don't think I've ever worn any other type of control-top underwear before that was actually effective without being constricting or ridiculously uncomfortable (I'd even go so far as to recommend buying these over more expensive brands like Spanx or Maiden Form).As for the complaints about having to order a size up:I ordered the XXL (my size in other brands) and XXXL (the size that was recommended) just to compare the fit. Although the fit in the XXL was tighter, I found it stretched out fine as I wore them; the XXXL fit more comfortably, but the biggest difference seemed to be in where the waistline hit me and that it didn't squeeze me in as much. column15: I'm not going to post a photo of me in this because I'm too shy (lol) but I am going to try to be specific as to how well this bra fit.Ok, so I'm mid-thirties, weigh about 130, am 5'3" and had my last baby 18 months before I bought this. I had stopped nursing about 4 months before buying and had also just been professionally fitted (which I highly recommend!) to determine how different I was post-nursing. I'm a 32 DD but I've been experiencing  the "where did my boobs go?!" problem since this last baby. I was looking for something with some "lift" and something that felt sexy at the same time and ran across this in my amazon searches. I was hesitant but decided to try anyway and bought myself the red.First of all, to get it out of the way, the underwear isn't a perfect fit. :( I could shed some fat around my hips and these would be better but they are currently too snug; not comfy to wear. Too bad you can't select underwear size so that's where the less than 5 star rating comes in.The bra fit surprisingly well. I'm impressed. It's a very wide band with multiple hooks so unless you have someone to help you, you can always hook in front then gently twist to the back. The straps are adjustable and not too long. The underwire of the cup fit me perfectly under and around my boob so I didn't experience any pinching or stabbing in the side. I employ the "swoop and scoop" method when donning a bra; my girls fit very neatly in the front of the bra with no spilling over the top or sides of the front while at the same time giving a nice push up. The middle front of the bra pulls together very nicely and comfortably. I like the triangle cut-out in front as it makes it look a bit different than other bras. On me, the wide lace on the sides of the bra lays nice and flat with no tugging or rolling up.All in all, I'm very happy with this set and despite the sizing of the underwear, I will likely buy this again in another color soon!

column11: I was really surprised at how well it fit and how comfortable it is—and how sexy—for just over $15 (at time ...
column15: This is one sexy lace plunge push up bra! I was really surprised at how well it fit and how comfortable it is—and how sexy—for just over $15 (at time of this review that is the price). Wow!I honestly didn’t expect much from it. I figured it would be something fun to wear every so often and if it didn’t last or didn’t fit quite as I wanted, I wasn’t out but just under $16.00. But surprisingly I could wear this under my clothes on those times when I want to feel sexy (tee hee).The panties I am not as much of a fan and it’s the only reason I don’t give this 5 stars. They are super cute, but they don’t fit as well as the top. They run a little smaller or perhaps it’s just that the band at the top is made tighter or banded in an awkward way for me and not flattering where it hits me on my hips. I wish it had a wider band and either fit lower or something to make it not feel so constrictive—I either have to pull them up and it looks ridiculous or if I try to pull them lower it just doesn’t look right.Really, I don’t care about the panties part at all, the bra is the star here and for the money I could toss the panties and not care one bit.I love the little peek-a-boo part between the cups of the bra, the lace that goes around my upper ribcage, the wider lacy straps—it’s just a fun sexy little bra. I’m glad I purchased it! For the money, it wouldn’t matter if it only held up 6 months—I did wash it in the washer and hung it to dry before I wore it and it did just fine. It’s not going to be super-supportive for every day use if you are big busted, but, again, for those times you want to feel and look sexy it’s perfect.

column15: I have been searching for the perfect panty for a long time. To me, the perfect panty does the following:1. Available in black (can't see blood stains)2. Lace waistline (elastic that's not large and flat leaves a line)3. NO ELASTIC around the leg (because all women are different and NONE of us have the same waist to hip to thigh ratio. Give me a break... no one wants elastic up their crotch or along a razor line)4. A substantial liner, for the occasional surprise-early monthly visitor.5. A natural fiber, but preferably something that doesn't hold water like cotton. (beechwood fiber or merino woven to feel like like cotton would fit the bill)This panty fits all but #4. There is a double fabric liner, and it's better than most panties, but it's not exactly what I want.#5 is close enough, but I would prefer a fabric that doesn't crave water like cotton. The only manufacturer that seems to understand that at all is MeUndies... but they have the problem with the waistline, cost too much, and also have an unsubstantial liner.I will continue my hunt, but these will get me through in the meantime. column3: Malco Modes Womens Sexy Ruffle Panties Tanga Dance Bloomers Sissy Booty Shorts
column15: I purchased these shorts as an addition to my upcoming Halloween costume - I plan to be a Jack the Ripper victim at the haunted house I work at, and am putting together a flashy burlesque-y ensemble to catch the eye and stand out. I found the XL to be a perfect fit for me, though I would prefer a lower rise, as I'm quite short in the hip, but rolling the waist over to give a lower rise should be easy enough. I have a 39" waist and 53" hips, and there is plenty of room in both for a larger person, so the sizing is comfy and generous. I have problems wearing elastic on my waist, as it usually causes uncomfortable pressure and back pain, but the elastic on these is thin enough that I don't have any problems. The lace ruffles are from the top of the hip bone down to the bottom, as shown in the picture, so your skirts will glide over the top part of the shorts easily, as they're satin in that area. The tag is actually on the outside, not the inside, so I was momentarily confused, though this may be a fluke on my pair. I will happily purchase other colors of these shorts in the future, should I need them, as the value for the price is outstanding. The seams are sound, and the fabric is sturdy. I don't have to worry about the lace itching, because it's on the outside and won't be touching my skin. I highly recommend these shorts if you're looking for a lacy, ruffled short.

column11: If You Don't Like Rough Fabric
column15: I needed something to go with a lacy top for a Leather & Lace party at a 21+ Renfair event. I absolutely love these. My only complaint is a personal preference, so I'm giving them a 5 star review and just putting the 'con' out there to warn others with sensory issues.Pros:  - SUPER stretchy! I went for an XL because that's what I bought swim bottoms in this year, and I -might- have been able to get away with the L because of how much stretch these have.  -  Cute! They definitely are adorable bloomers!  I was worried they'd come all scrunched looking and the lace would be sticking out in odd ways, but the were nicely folded and looked fine on.  - They have a mesh gusset for airflow. Definitely a necessity, especially in the warmer seasons.Cons  - Lace and inside of bloomers are itchy/scratchy. I hate rough/coarse fabrics and avoid them whenever possible. It's a sensory thing.  The lace is really, really scratchy feeling. It's not soft at all, though keep in mind lace generally isn't. I could deal with this a little better if the inside was lined. While the lace isn't on the inside, the stitching and fabric still lead to a distracting sensory situation in the nether parts. Even a super thin lining of a software/sleeker material would be helpful here. Thankfully, I do have black boy short style undies, which will help mitigate some of the sensation. Definitely don't expect to wear only these if you have are particular about fabrics.

column7: ['shapewear', 'good quality', 'form fitting', 'highly recommend', 'muffin top', 'tummy control', 'well made', 'stays in place', 'back fat', 'robert matthew', 'small medium', 'feel like', 'thigh area', 'body shaper', 'around the thighs', 'tight around', 'definitely recommend', 'fits great', 'lbs and ordered', 'mid thigh']
column11: If I may make a suggestion...
column15: So I bought this body shaper for a special event coming up. It arrived in great condition, well-packed and all that. I tried it on for size - all good. It snugs in at all the right places, and does not feel like it is rolling up/ down while at the same time I can breathe. There's just one small problem that I can foresee... there's no crotch opening. I will be wearing a dress and a crinoline with this. I'm trying to imagine being in a tiny stall in a public restroom trying to wrestle this thing down past all that AND worse still, back up. The event is eight hours long, so it will be an interesting time. I'm giving it a go because it really does a good job at shaping which is its primary function. However, I would ask the manufacturer to have a heart. Once you have all that spandex situated just so, you sure don't want to have to do it over and over again. Let's face it, most women will reserve this type of undergarment for special occasions where she is already putting up with heels, netting, slips, static cling, push-up bras, and heaven forbid hosiery. The least manufacturers can do is make going to the bathroom an activity that doesn't require two lady's maids and a crowbar.

column15: Nobody is perfect despite how much we may love our bodies. I, for one, love my curves, but I also know what is flattering on me and what isn't. Unfortunately, I have to wear a dress this holiday season for a wedding that is NOT flattering on me. I've purchased and returned, and researched multiple items on Amazon in hopes to find the ideal undergarment that would work to flatter me. From Spanx to complicated contraptions- none seemed to flatter me. I felt like a tube of Pillsbury dough rolls that had just been popped open with the dough spilling out at the seems. Luckily, I ran into these babies.Here we go!Firstly, I value comfort. These have all the comfort of your favorite granny parties.Secondly, the strategic placement of the lace actually works to smooth out love handles WITHOUT SQUEEZING THEM, thus avoiding the Pillsbury dough phenomenon.Thirdly, it's not a body shaper, but it does have some tummy control. It smooths out problem areas rather than aim to make you look like you've lost a few inches.Overall, I'm really impressed by the quality and ability for this product to fulfill its advertised purpose. I can't get over how adorably retro these look.

column15: Contrary to many of the reviews here I do not consider these to be "granny underwear" (I am 19 for reference). Instead, with how the lower lace is see-through, it gives me a vintage pin up vibe when I first tried them on. I purchased these since I love high waisted briefs as a way to give myself support as a result of a minor childhood injury that flares up once and a while.These have a very well sewn waist, with perfect elastic! They have not ridden down or curled up once since I bought them, and I have not had any defective pairs. That being said, the elastic is not tight enough to hurt when sitting as some of the tighter elastics can, and the lace is still sturdy at the edges, just offering a tasteful window underneath. The top lace is not sheer, but that seems obvious in the pictures of the product anyway.As for the shape wear properties, I cannot say for sure, since I didn't need them for that reason. That being said I did notice a bit of a lift on the back, which was nice, and it did smooth down the overall skin, from what I could tell. I would recommend this product to anyone needing support in their lower abdomen, or looking for modest sexy panties.One last thing to mention that was not quite 5 star worthy: A few of the pink/neutral pairs had a smell I can only describe as chemical/almost fecal? I washed them before putting them on and that got the smell out, but it's worth mentioning it may have been the dye that smelled after being brand new and shoved in a plastic package at who knows what temperature while it shipped.

column15: I'm 5'6", 32-29-39, and ordered the Neutral pack in size Small. It's so hard to find cotton nude colored thongs to wear under lighter colored leggings or leggings that might not be 100% squat-proof.  These thongs fit the bill. column11: I can almost fully embrace these granny panties!
column15: These are absolutely exactly as pictured - for better or for worse - in all their granny panty glory!  They would be a bit sexier if they were all sheer lace (and lacked that satiny panel in the front) and if the waistband was totally seamless (and lacked the thick elastic band that shows through and may dig in).  But the raw seamless edges around the legs and sheer rear do help with the sexy factor.  They are flattering, incredibly soft, and very comfortable!  But I am a 99.9% thong wearer - so I can't compare them to any sort of full coverage bikini brief type item.  The lace has a nice stretch to it and doesn't feel cheap or itchy.  The crotch liner (95% cotton/5% spandex - NOT 100% cotton, as stated) is white on all colors (black, navy, pink, nude, white) in my pack, which is a fail for me.  Sometimes you need a good black granny panty during that time of the month - and with white lining, just no.  Plus, the lining is way too low, like, at the butt and doesn't protect lady parts.  So far, they do very well in the laundry (machine wash, dry flat).  I was fully expecting them to be too big since I really am an XXS, but they fit reasonably well with the stretch.  3.5 stars rounded up to 4, as they are well-priced.

column15: The bra is beautiful, super feminine, very pretty and comfortable, it fit perfect and was true to size. Just like in the picture and it makes you feel very sexy.  I'm impressed. The underwire of the cup fit me perfectly under and around my boob so I didn't experience any pinching or stabbing in the side. I employ the "swoop and scoop" method when donning a bra; my girls fit very neatly in the front of the bra with no spilling over the top or sides of the front while at the same time giving a nice push up. The middle front of the bra pulls together very nicely and comfortably. I like the triangle cut-out in front as it makes it look a bit different than other bras. column15: First of all, they do seem to be more shorts than underwear.  The label on the package says Yoga - Workout Shorts with an MSRP of $45 for the three-pack. There’s nothing sexy about them —unless you think red is sexy. (But it probably says “sexy” on the other colors.) I’ll just put it down to an over-exuberant copy writer. They’re certainly not likely to increase the sex appeal of chubby women!I’m looking for non-chafing undies to wear under my fantastic Macabi travel skirts. These are fine for the long skirts but probably a bit too long (I’m under 5’ and they come to about 2” above my knees) for the knee-length skirt. And that’s why I chose red. Thinking they’ll be cooler if they peek out.  But they won’t be cooler in temperature although 95% cotton and 5% spandex seems to be a pretty a good combination. They’re not sheer but are definitely much lighter weight, say, than cotton knit shorts or even most capri-length, knit, exercise pants. (Made in Bangladesh).I was going to order XXL based on the “happy size 16 thighs” review, but with a way too tight XL from another brand lying around, I decided to play it safe and order the XXXL.  The package came with two XXL and one XXXL!! Held up together they appear to be the same size. And there is no noticeable difference in tightness when I tried them on. What can I tell you? The quality seems OK but who knows how long they will last. Having 3 pairs will stretch out their longevity. (Ha! An unintended pun there)They do stretch so that undies would probably be visible but would work out fine as gym (or whatever) shorts if you wear a long T-shirt that covers your butt and the top of your thighs (or just use pantiliners). The shade is a nice, bright orangie red as opposed to cherry red (more warm than cool red).  I certainly would be willing to order the other color options tho I’ll keep looking for a slightly shorter length (too hard to cut and sew stretchy knit fabric). Price was good.Update: I grabbed a pair and lo and behold: they DID feel a bit loose and they WERE the 3XL. Sooo. If you’re closer to size 18 than 16 get the 3XL. I think a size 20 gal would be OK with them as well.

Well, here's what I had:1 orange and white horizontal striped thong with string sides (no label)1 purple thong with wide pinkish lace band and bow (bonprix collection, 60% cotton, 36% polyamide, 4% elastane)1 blue thong with wide lace band (preambule, 90% polyamide, 10% elastane)1 black thong with thin vertical stripes, lace features and pink bow (secret love, nylon/elastane/polyester)1 cheeky white complete lace with wide band (body key, 85% polyester, 15% elastane)1 white complete lace thong with wide band (no company, 90% nylon, 10% elastane)1 black lay-flat thong (not sure the right term - kind of a step up from laser-cut) (secret treasures, 89% nylon, 11% spandex)1 beige lay-flat thong (same as the above)1 heather gray thong with white and pink wide logo band (bjorn borg, 51% modal, 41% cotton, 8% elastane)1 black thong with white and black medium width logo band (bjorn borg, 91% polyamide, 9% elastane)There's only one I probably won't be wearing at all because it's on the small side, which I think 9 out of 10 is a pretty outcome for a blind buy. Glad to see only two bows - I'll probably cut them off as I generally don't like them. Otherwise, some will be more in rotation than others, but that's more personal preference / mood I think. Overall just increasing my options which is what I had in mind. I could see ordering these again when the time comes.

column3: Curve Muse Sexy Comfy Women’s Satin Thong Panties Strings Underwear-Pack of 8
column11: Nice but you don't get what is pictured AT ALL!!
column15: These were really pretty and not a bad price considering you get 8 of them. I'm sure I would have loved these..IF THE ONES I ORDERED WERE ACTUALLY THE ONES I GOT!!! I'd never order from them again until they can actually photograph what you actually will get!! The print WAYYYY down at the bottom states "you may not get exact colors" etc.Well there are 8 pair and I got 3 doubles out of 8 total!! They show all these various pretty colored ones and what you get is 2 pair of one style..2 pair of another style..and 2 pair of another style..then one other..then one other. So what happens, which was EXACTLY what I hoped would NOT happen..I got doubles of the ones I don't like so much and I NEVER GOT THE TWO THAT I INITIALLY ORDERED THESE FOR!!! There is nothing WORSE then to SEE what you want, PAY for it, then get NONE of the style you wanted!! So yes..read all the way at the bottom of their description and KNOW..you will NOT get what is pictured!! When THIS company can correct that..people should NOT order these at ALL!! It's like wanting an apple and ordering it..then they bring you a lemon!! WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME!!

column3: Curve Muse Sexy Comfy Women’s Satin Thong Panties Strings Underwear-Pack of 8
column15: That's a very  cute looking panties for the price . And hey, I did not expect them to be  a high quality - I know how much I paid for them, so let's be realistic here . U would not want to wear them all day long bc of uncovered elastic inside( see video),  but they would be awesome for showing off and looking pretty. One of received has a loose threads on it, but come on, I am not gonna wear them for 5 years strait , so I am ok with that. Before posting this review , I washed them twice ( in a mesh bag, regular setting) - nothing happened , and air dried - I think hot air would damage the fabric. The colors are super cheerful and omg, how bored I am of all grey/black /beige plain cotton  overwhelming the market, so those colorful panties are like a breath of fresh air ! What do u need to know : they made of thin, shiny, rustling polyester, very lightweight, become softer after washing, lightly constructed and stretch very well, have tiny cotton gusset , fit comfortably, sizing is correct ( my hips are 38, ordered size M, fit me well ),  colors are bright. Please be aware of the elastic band mentioned above - it could really irritate, so no prolong walking in this panties. Overall:  for 2.25 a pair I absolutely enjoy this flirty panties and I definitely look pretty and sexy  in them ).  4 stars instead of 5 for that uncovered elastic band.

column3: Intimate Portal Women Under The Bump Maternity Panties Pregnancy Underwear
column7: ['maternity underwear', 'highly recommend', 'super comfy', 'months pregnant', 'low cut', 'full coverage', 'weeks pregnant', 'normally wear', 'super comfortable', 'regular underwear', 'baby bump', 'growing belly', 'pre pregnancy', 'good quality', 'definitely recommend', 'usually wear', 'love love love', 'coverage in the back', 'victoria secret', 'another set']
column15: These are ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! We all go through that phase of pregnancy where we think we can actually make our regular underwear work until the end. Then somewhere between 20-30 weeks we hit that wall of surrender and realize we need new underwear...NOW! Like yesterday.This is my 4th pregnancy, and I've never found underwear this cute or this comfortable. I started thinking about a design that might actually work well for me and found these online. Then I looked everywhere for this style in stores because I didn't want to buy underwear online that might not work. I couldn't find this style in stores, so I broke down and ordered it online. I'm so glad I took the risk and bought the 5 pack!!!It has a flattering shape under my belly, and doesn't add ANY pressure to my already tight abdomen. I feel sexier in my panties than I've ever felt at this stage of pregnancy.I am 5' 7". I’m around 130lbs when I'm not pregnant. I generally wear a medium pre-pregnancy and it gives me a little extra room. I'm active, in good shape, and on track to gain ~30lbs with this pregnancy  (which is a healthy amount for me). I listened to reviews and bought the large instead of the medium. I thought they might be too big after they came in, but once I laundered them they fit quite well with a tiny bit of stretch room to carry me through the end of pregnancy.I cannot explain how happy I am with these underwear. I use these 5 underwear in combination with 3 Hanky Panky low-rise thongs (worth every penny!!!), and I've never been more happy with my maternity undergarments. Just wish I'd had them for my last 3 pregnancies.SIDE NOTE: WHY HAS IT TAKEN THE MATERNITY INDUSTRY SO LONG TO FIGURE OUT THIS DESIGN?!!! And where are the jeans like this?! Granted you'd need a long shirt, but seriously, pregnant women have been folding their pants down for decades. When women like a style enough to deal with extra bulk... Someone please catch on!!!Also, I can't get my poor husband's name off of this review. :/

column15: I was super excited to try these, since wearing most normal undies while pregnant is uncomfortable.  Now, I am a petite gal.. and not necessarily a hot box by any means.  I am generally a bit cold in most environments. However, these panties do NOT breathe at all, making me very hot and bothered.. and not in a good way.  Plus, the crotch liner's top seam is very low and cuts right at my inner bits, so they are very irritating to wear.  I can't wear them for more than like 5 minutes (if) without tossing them off and wishing I would not have bought them.  I know lots of ladies that love this blend for their undies, and several brands use this blend, but I can't stand it myself.  I wish it was not so hard to find pure, 100% soft cotton undies.  The under-the-belly part is the only good aspect about these.

column11: It is TIGHT - that is how it is supposed to be
column15: I am a size 16/18 with a belly.  I bought a 3X because so many people said it runs so small.  I should have bought a 2X and I will next.  I want to say:  this is a waist trainer - it is supposed to be TIGHT, I mean really, really tight, otherwise it will not train your waist.  You should have to lie down and pull on both sides as hard as you can to get it to close.  Then when you start, you can only wear it for a few hours each day and gradually you can wear it for longer.  So if you want to train your waist, ignore all of the people who say it is too small.I'm giving it 5 stars because it is a good product.  I like how the back is high.  I had one before that did not go up my back and the waist trainer just pushed all of my back fat up in a huge roll just under my bra, so that didn't work.

I feel like this is a perfect medium for someone who is actively waist training. It holds you but still has the flexibility so you can move about normally. column11: I love em! And so does my husband ;-)
column15: I am a fairly thick woman, 5 ft, 175 lbs, usually a size large in leggings. I didnt want to risk them needing to stretch too much because I didn't want them to become see through, so I ordered up a size as other reviewers suggested and  they fit perfectly. They are even squat proof! (I tested it in a bright bathroom, so believe me, as long as you order the right size and they aren't too small and stretched to the max, they are NOT see through!The honeycomb texture of these leggings completely conceals any dimples or cellulite. The waistband is pretty high so any tummy is sucked in, which is critical for me, as I just had a baby 3 months ago. I am been blessed with a pretty good butt, but these give it an extra oomph. I just put them on for the first time and my husband came in and made a point to say how amazing my "assets " look!  I was standing in front the mirror in the bathroom, and I even caught him in the reflection continueing to stare lol!My only complaint is that they are pretty long. I am very short  and normally have bunching at the ankles with most leggings,  but I have more bunching than usual with these.Even so its not enough to take away how pleased I am with these leggings. I'll be washing them in the delicate cycle to ensure they don't get ruined, so hopefully they hold up! I'll likely had to get another pair since I like them so much.

column15: I HATE wearing thongs. Never been the kind of girl that wears thongs. I have always found them to be extremelt uncomfortable.  I stopped wearing thongs years ago when I finally decided that I wasn’t going to torture myself anymore and just decided to wear regular cotton panties.  While the panties are usually wear are very comfortable, I have “panty lines” on my backside when I wear workout clothes, yoga pants, or leggings (which is all I wear).  My boyfriend pointed out the fact that the panty lines were very visible and since then I’ve became self-conscious.  I started to wear long shirts that cover my backside because I didn’t want my panty lines showing...  after doing that for a while I’ve decided that I would consider wearing thongs again to avoid the panty lines and so I came to Amazon and started reading reviews in hopes of finding thongs that are comfortable.  I am 5‘4“ tall and 136 pounds. I wear a size medium, however, the 6 pack that I wanted to buy was not available in a size medium so I ordered a size small. I received them today.  When I first tried one on and I looked in a mirror I was pretty upset. The size small was small on me (I knew I needed a size medium). Anyways, I thought about returning them but was upset because I knew Amazon was out of the medium size and surprisingly, theae were so comfortable that I wanted to keep them. I took the thing and stretched it. I grabbed one end with one hand and the other end with the other hand and stretched it out as far as it would. Then I tried them on again and BAM! They were no longer small around my wasit! They fitted me perfectly!!! So I decided to keep the small size. These are very very comfy. Feels like wearing nothing at all and no panty lines anymore!!!!! I can see myself wearing these everyday :)

column15: So I initially followed the listing instructions about ordering a size up but that was way to big so I returned it. Today I received my “normal” size and it actually fits great.Now for why I love this bra - I used to be a hearty C cup for years and years. I could wear a normal non push up bra and have great cleveage, but the last few years I have been dealing with an illness that has taken a lot of toll on my body. I lost 30+ lbs. and have a hard time maintaining any weight gain. Sooo my lush Cs turned into tiny tiny As. None of my cute lingerie fit anymore and I’ve worn bralettes as a replacement, that means NO cleveage. ZERO. I figured finding cute bras to give me any push up was a waste of time because what is there to push up??? Till I found this bra, there was a heart sinking moment when I couldn’t remotely fill the cups of the 34A but the smaller size has answered my prayers! 32A and all the way cinched up I have actual cleveage!!! I can’t believe it! I forgot what that feels like.Now bralettes are way more comfortable no doubt but this is PERFECT for date nights or whenever I want a little boost.Now your tits are certainly not the end all be all of your self worth and that needs to be said. But the ability to transform yourself is one I hold in the highest regard and this bra is an amazing tool for that. This opens me up that there are cute push ups for A cups and I will probably get another one!

column15: I was always wary to try shaping garments, so this was my first and it honestly surpassed my expectations. I didn't think that these would be anything but a pair of extremely high-waisted underwear but they actually did bring my tummy in enough that I could confidently wear a bodycon dress (which is a HUGE deal for me). I've lost weight since I ordered these so I definitely plan to order another pair soon!

column11: Good product. Bad fit for post partum body
column15: Super cute and sexy. Nice and soft materials. Runs large. I thought the 5x would be a tad too small if not spot on, based off the reviews and size chart. But they are pretty big on me. The lace around the butt part just kind of hangs off me and doesn’t look good at all. The tag appears to be ripped out of them as well. Not sure if it was a manufacturing mistake or if they were returned after they were worn. I did the old try on over your current panties trick (like with swimsuits). And they were still really loose on me. My butt is sort of flat from having hip problems during my last pregnancy which ended 2 months ago. And the top of the underwear run right along my c-section scar.. so my belly kind of hangs over them.. ick. But if you’ve got a bubble butt and no belly overhang, This might look good on you. Just didn’t work for my post partum body.

column11: Honest Review (I did not receive anything in return)
column15: First of all, thank you to the company for listing a chart with their sizes in relationship to woman's jean sizes. 🙌 Because let's be honest, I'm not going to measure myself, but especially not to buy just underwear. So I really appreciate when companies tell you what their sizes actually mean, instead of you having to guess what size you may be.With that being said, I am usually a size 20 in jeans and picked 5x and I should have picked the 4x because these were big on me.These are also more like buttless panties as they cover your front 'area'. But I asked my boyfriend... after 😉 what he thought of them, and if he liked my other sexy panties I have more, less, or the same as these?His reply: "Well I didn't have to take these off, which I like, so more" (He's not a big talker)So to recap if you close or in between sizes definitely go down, and just know that they are more buttless than crochless, but my boyfriend followed me after just seeing a peek, so they are a 5 in book. 😉
